page.title: 09RELIGION
page.content: There are 5 places of worship in Alford, St Wilfrids Church, the Methodist Church, Congregational, Pentecostal and Catholic Churches, also a church in Bilsby.{Canon Ifor {George-Jones}is the vicar with two curates and two lay readers. The {Reverend Muriel Frampton}is the Methodist Minister. The other churches have no priest resident in Alford.{Mr {Robinson}is the deacon of the Congregational church,{Father Shaw from Mablethorpe the priest attending the Catholic church and{Miss Mole}the secreatary of the Pentecostal. St Wilfrids Church and the Methodist church each have two services every Sunday, the others one. All of them have a Sunday School, the Methodist church having 70 children with{Mrs {M.Sutton}as the superintendent.
